content.question: Which of the following statements about the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over n, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is true?

choices.label: The series diverges by the <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mtext>th</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> term test.

The series diverges by comparison to the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series diverges by limit comparison to the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series diverges by limit comparison to the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
